metadata.title: Tuesday, 20th February, 2018
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE TWELFTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) whether the Government is aware that the 25% import duty charged on finished petroleum products is a contributing factor to the high cost of fuel in the country;
(b) if so, whether there are any plans to scrap off the import duty in order to reduce the cost of fuel; and
(c) if there are no such plans, what measures are being taken to reduce the cost of fuel.
(a) what the doctor-patient ratio at the Kanyama First Level Hospital in Kanyama Parliament Constituency is;
(b) what the nurse-patient ratio at the Hospital is; and
(c) when additional doctors and nurses will be deployed to the Hospital.
(a) how many hectares of maize were planted in the 2016/2017 farming season in Mpongwe Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) how many hectares were affected by the fall army worms; and
(c) what the yield in the Constituency was.
(a) when the construction of a new police station in Katete District will resume;
(b) why the Government terminated the contract for the contractor who was on site;
(c) what the cost of the Project is; and
(d) what the time-frame for the completion of the project is.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to print ballot papers for the 2021 general elections locally; and
(b) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) whether there was any cattle at the National Institute of Scientific and Industrial Research on Airport Road in Lusaka as of 31st May, 2017;
(b) if so, what the total head of cattle was; and
(c) if there was none, what happened to the head of cattle that was at the Institute prior to the date at (a).
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct police posts in the following areas in Mufumbwe District:
(i) Mushima; and (ii) Miluji;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) how many houses were destroyed by fire in Chimwemwe Parliamentary Constituency from 2010 to 2016, year by year;
(b) what form of assistance the Government rendered to the affected families;
(c) whether the Government has any plans to make homeowners insurance compulsory; and
(d) if so, how the insurance premium will be collected.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct additional public libraries in Ndola Central Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) whether the Government has any plans to restock the existing public libraries with modern books and other literature; and
(d) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to procure motor vehicles for the following police posts in Ndola Central Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Nkwazi; (ii) Mapalo; (iii) Twapia; and (iv) Dag Hammarksjoed; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to establish a Multi-Facility Economic Zone near the Copperbelt International Airport;
(b) if so, how many hectares of land are required for the project; and
(c) how many companies are earmarked to be accommodated at the Zone.

questions.minister: Minister of Lands and Natural Resources
parts: (a) what the total value of the Mukula logs confiscated as of 31st December, 2017, was;
(b) whether the Government is aware that the Mukula logs are losing value due to exposure to the sun and rain;
(c) if so, what measures the Government is taking to secure the logs and avoid total loss of value;
(d) what measures the Government is taking to control the indiscriminate cutting of the Mukula tree; and
(e) whether the measures at (d) are yielding the desired results.
(a) whether the Government is aware that the two boreholes at Nansenga Secondary School in Chikankata Parliamentary Constituency have dried up;
(b) if so, when the Government will sink another borehole at the School; and
(c) what the estimated cost of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Housing and Infrastructure Development
parts: (a) when the tarring of the Chikankata Road from the Kafue-Mazabuka road junction which stalled in 2016, will resume;
(b) what the name of the contractor for the project is;
(c) what the total cost of the project is; and
(d) what the time-frame for the completion of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Youth, Sport and Child Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a youth skills development centre at Mulilansolo in Chilinda area in Chinsali Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) when the Zambia-Tanzania-Kenya Power Interconnector Project will be completed; and
(b) what has caused the delay in completing the Project. 121. Mr Simbao (Senga Hill) – to ask the Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry:
(a) how many Multi-Facility Economic Zones (MFEZs) were operational as of 30th December, 2017;
(b) how many companies were operating in the following MFEZs:
(i) Lusaka South; and (ii) Chambeshi;
(c) how many companies at (b) are involved in value addition to local products; and
(d) whether the MFEZs that are operational have met the objectives for which they were created.
(a) what the total cash net flow as of 2016 was;
(b) how much of the total cash net flow was Foreign Direct Investment (FDI);
(c) how much the Foreign Portfolio Investment (FPI) was; and
(d) what the FPI/FDI ratio was.
(a) which cattle diseases are prevalent in Kalabo District; and
(b) what measures have been taken to eradicate the diseases.

questions.minister: Minister of Water Development, Sanitation and Environmental Protection
parts: (a) how many boreholes were earmarked for sinking in Kalabo District in 2017;
(b) how many boreholes were actually sunk and water pumps installed;
(c) of the water pumps installed, how many are solar powered and, if none, why; and

(d) when the Government will commence installing solar powered water pumps.
